DOC.HEADLINE: 2nd LD: Former Zambian President Chiluba judged not guilty in graft case

TEXT.P: 2nd LD: Former Zambian President Chiluba judged not guilty in graft case
LUSAKA, Aug. 17 (Xinhua) -- Zambia's former president Frederick Chiluba, who had been accused of embezzling 500,000 U.S. dollars in public funds, was cleared of his corruption charges on Monday.
The Lusaka magistrate's court ruled that Chiluba was of no guilty of all the 12 charges against him in the case.

The trial started early in the morning and lasted for six hours before the ruling was announced by Judge Jones Chinyama. Jones Chinyama said the prosecution team had failed to prove the case against Chiluba.
The judge said that an important attestor failed to show up during the trial, adding that "I find that the accused is not guilty on all counts."
Chiluba's corruption case closed in March this year and judgment was set for July 20 this year.
But the judgment was last month deferred to August 14 in light of the consent judgment passed to allow Chiluba file his submissions out of the court's time.
On Aug. 14, the case was postponed again to August 17, with the reason of "the judge is not ready" then.
